text: I got it working
I like the CSS based config.

does anybody know what `[missing "en.app.layoutStyles.editStyles-cleanLines-module" translation]` is referring to? It's in the place of the module name in the editor. I am using an English module on a Japanese configured blog. Is there a place to store translation data?
cool, I'll give it a try. Do you happen to know if it supports the old tailwind typography and form plugins?
I think it's something I need to add to the meta export or maybe there's a language folder I need to add somewhere...
is there a list of all possible `meta` fields somewhere?
yes, I just installed the latest tailwind-typography and it worked, so i'd assume the same for forms plugin.
I'm try to get flowbite working as they have a data-attribute model that should work for simple interactivity like accordions and avoid CSR island.
that's cool, I haven't heard of flowbite before—checking it out
I usually use shadcn (manual setup version)
I really like Shadcn as it doesn't add as a dependency. However, I was looking for a solution to get add event listeners to SSR generated HTML and flowbite already has data attribute triggers API.
why do avoid CSR islands?
IMO for simple components it's better for SEO to have static HTML content.
Accordion, Modals, banners, dropdowns, etc
maybe i'm too old school and don't trust that Google can read CSR content, lol.
ha, yea, maybe but there's probably at least some truth to that
I'm fairly new to React and not sure if there's a way to achieve hydration of existing SSR DOM elements.

this I another library I've looked at in the past, pre Tailwind. I really like how it has plugins to generate field props for headless CMS based on component schema file. <https://www.kickstartds.com/>
would be nice if you could auto generate module fields from Types.
I'm technically newish too...I'll have to look back over that a bit later today/next week
HubSpot will help you do the opposite though, generate types from module fields

Been developing so long with HUBL,HTML,CSS,JS that didn’t really have an urgency to learn React. However CRM components changed that. I haven’t played around with this yet as I didn’t like that the code was split between projects and Design Manager . The new  project theme changes as everything lives in project, can’t make changes in  DM, so you can be certain of version control using git.
I kinda wish there was an option to use Nunjucks as it would be an easier transition from HUBL since it’s similar to Jinja2.

how does the healthchecks <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/reference/build-healthchecks.html#build-health-check-configuration> work with project themes? get a message that cms-assets.json isn't needed with theme.json
